remark.p: Foreign Service Officer. Assistant Secretary of State for Economic, Energy, and Business Affairs; Representative of the U.S.A. to the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development (Paris); Representative of the U.S.A. to the European Union, with the rank and status of Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary.

Director, Office of International Trade, Bureau of Economic Affairs, Department of State, until August 14, 1965; thereafter Deputy Assistant Secretary of State for International Trade Policy, Bureau of Economic Affairs

Deputy Assistant Secretary of State for Economic Affairs, February-July 1969; Representative to the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development in Paris, July 1969-October 1972; thereafter Representative to the European Communities in Brussels

Assistant Secretary of State for Economic Affairs, February-July 1969; Representative to the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development in Paris, July 1969-October 1972; thereafter Representative to the European Communities in Brussels

Deputy Assistant Secretary of State for Economic Affairs, February–July 1969; Representative to the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development in Paris, July 1969–October 1972; thereafter, Representative to the European Communities in Brussels
Representative to the European Communities until January 1976; Assistant Secretary of State for Economic and Business Affairs from February until September 1976
U.S. Representative to the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development from July 1969 until October 1972
U.S. Representative to the European Communities until January 28, 1976; Assistant Secretary of State for Economic and Business Affairs, February 11, 1976–September 10, 1976

Deputy Assistant Secretary of State for Economic Affairs, February–July 1969; Representative to the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development in Paris, July 1969–October 1972; thereafter Representative to the European Communities in Brussels
Assistant Secretary for Economic and Business Affairs, Department of State
Bureau of Economic and Business Affairs, Department of State, 1976
Representative to the European Communities from October 1972 until Janaury 1976; Assistant Secretary of State for Economic and Business Affairs from February 1976 until September 1976
